Articles.Content:
Woohoo! Downloading!

For the V-2, I'd ask that you make the engine separately from the shroud (indeed, it'd be awesome if that were the case for the XLR11 as well), so it can be used for any rocket, not just its "designer purpose."

Also, Scott Manley points out that you really should have a broom handle in the IVA. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

For reference:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tPrFjNRKKiI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
I like the idea of functional switches in IVA, but MFDs is silly in an X-1

Saw this one on Reddit first for once, glad to find the thread. Makes a really good early tech cockpit. 

Is it wrong that my first thought is to go the Flash Gordon route and use it as a rocket capsule? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Great work Beale.

> 
> Woohoo! Downloading!
> For the V-2, I'd ask that you make the engine separately from the shroud (indeed, it'd be awesome if that were the case for the XLR11 as well), so it can be used for any rocket, not just its "designer purpose."
> 
> Also, Scott Manley points out that you really should have a broom handle in the IVA. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> For reference:
> 
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tPrFjNRKKiI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Many thanks!

Shroudless engines will be added, why not ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The XLR11 especially is very pretty to look at.

> 
> I like the idea of functional switches in IVA, but MFDs is silly in an X-1

I'll tell you what is silly in an X-1, the fact that it is very nearly an SSTO ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

![e8582a14e7.jpg](http://puu.sh/jXSwC/e8582a14e7.jpg)

On a more serious note, I am thinking some form of IVA extras will be nice. Even if no MFD, the other JSI props are still very nice to have.

> 
> Saw this one on Reddit first for once, glad to find the thread. Makes a really good early tech cockpit. 
> Is it wrong that my first thought is to go the Flash Gordon route and use it as a rocket capsule? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> 
> Great work Beale.

Many thanks! Glad it is enjoyed, go for the Flash Gordon route and follow your heart!

> 
> On a more serious note, I am thinking some form of IVA extras will be nice. Even if no MFD, the other JSI props are still very nice to have.
> Many thanks! Glad it is enjoyed, go for the Flash Gordon route and follow your heart!

Congrats on the release. Here is an analog cockpit made with the aset props.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2vImpRk4pw8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
. From [this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96148-V5-0-RC1-released-AeroKerbin-Industries-Modified-IVAs).

So I built an X-1 clone, and boy does it hate going supersonic in FAR

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/AVaI0)

> 
> So I built an X-1 clone, and boy does it hate going supersonic in FAR
> [http://imgur.com/a/AVaI0](http://imgur.com/a/AVaI0)

kinda understandable when you remember swept wings were a key to going supersonic yet the the bell x1 has straight wings. Very very thin straight wings that far might not simulate correctly even if we had them ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Awh man so the "Beale X-1" title isn't meant to be, eh?

> 
> kinda understandable when you remember swept wings were a key to going supersonic yet the the bell x1 has straight wings. Very very thin straight wings that far might not simulate correctly even if we had them ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I know, the wavedrag and cross section looked atrocious in the editor
Congrats Beale. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I know, the wavedrag and cross section looked atrocious in the editor

the bell wasn't all that "innovative" if you think about it. Just an overkill sheer brute force application of conventional thinking for the period (they modeled the body after a .50cal bullet an object they knew broke the speed of sound for pete's sake) naturally they wouldn't make a perfect supersonic record breaker on their first try ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Hooray! Now to break out the kerb paint... ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Needs moar orange!

Lol looks great man. Nice addition to my collection

> 
> Needs moar orange!
> Lol looks great man. Nice addition to my collection

I second this.

Rockomax orange would be a close fit
This is awesome and just what I wanted, but can the X-1 be in Orange?
The later X-1s were indeed painted white, but it would be nice to have orange as an option.
Hopefully we can get an alternate texture for an orange X-1.

> 
> Hooray! Now to break out the kerb paint... ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Needs moar orange!
> Lol looks great man. Nice addition to my collection

> 
> I second this.
> Rockomax orange would be a close fit

> 
> This is awesome and just what I wanted, but can the X-1 be in Orange?

> 
> The later X-1s were indeed painted white, but it would be nice to have orange as an option.

> 
> Hopefully we can get an alternate texture for an orange X-1.

Beale usually uploads the source photoshop files for the textures he makes to a dropbox repository in his signature. One enterprising replica maker would simply need to make a change to the base color layer, re export it, and share the result with others.

> 
> So I built an X-1 clone, and boy does it hate going supersonic in FAR
> [http://imgur.com/a/AVaI0](http://imgur.com/a/AVaI0)

Oh nice!

It's quite pleasing that it has semi-realistic performance in FAR, but I think the engine still needs a bit of a Nerf.

> 
> Awh man so the "Beale X-1" title isn't meant to be, eh?

Would be a little self indulgent eh? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Congrats Beale. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Many thanks!

> 
> Beale usually uploads the source photoshop files for the textures he makes to a dropbox repository in his signature. One enterprising replica maker would simply need to make a change to the base color layer, re export it, and share the result with others.

**Orange**

Base texture available now in signature!

Can't wait to see if people cook up some Orange remixes! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Speaking of engine, as suggested: An unclad version.

Would fit great with 0.3125m.

But I am torn, 0.3125m is half 0.625m and fits nicely, but is very close to a Ã†â€˜oot, US unit of measurement, which could be funny to adopt.

Eh, but this is kind of strange business... not entirely sure if I would include this new size with stockalike pack by extra (Maybe include an "extras" folder).

For this too, an Aerobee might be as large as 0.625m in diameter for the sake of compatibility.

![14a775445e.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYAsR/14a775445e.jpg)

![fe728b9708.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYAuk/fe728b9708.jpg)

![fc247e662b.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYAQZ/fc247e662b.jpg)

Falcon nine? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

![925604aa92.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYB8l/925604aa92.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-03T15:33:31Z" title="09/03/2015 03:33  PM" data-short="8 yr">September 3, 2015</time> by Beale**

> 
> Speaking of engine, as suggested: An unclad version.
> Would fit great with 0.3125m.
> 
> But I am torn, 0.3125m is half 0.625m and fits nicely, but is very close to a Ã†â€˜oot, US unit of measurement, which could be funny to adopt.
> 
> Eh, but this is kind of strange business... not entirely sure if I would include this new size with stockalike pack by extra (Maybe include an "extras" folder).
> 
> For this too, an Aerobee might be as large as 0.625m in diameter for the sake of compatibility.
> 
> [http://puu.sh/jYAsR/14a775445e.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYAsR/14a775445e.jpg)
> 
> [http://puu.sh/jYAuk/fe728b9708.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYAuk/fe728b9708.jpg)
> 
> [http://puu.sh/jYAQZ/fc247e662b.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYAQZ/fc247e662b.jpg)
> 
> Falcon nine? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> 
> [http://puu.sh/jYB8l/925604aa92.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYB8l/925604aa92.jpg)

0.3125m is already used by two other sounding rocket mods so it has about as much adoption as 1.875m and more than 0.9375m I think you'd be fine as long as you keep the shrouded version around for those who want to trim out extra sizes.

> 
> 0.3125m is already used by two other sounding rocket mods so it has about as much adoption as 1.875m and more than 0.9375m I think you'd be fine as long as you keep the shrouded version around for those who want to trim out extra sizes.

Huh!

I did not know that, probably a better size to use then.

The only sounding rocket mod I knew of [uses 0.35m](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102502-1-0-2-Sounding-Rockets!-Start-small-Dream-big!-0-2-1-2015-05-15)

Anyway, this very small size isn't a huge problem if the engine is surface attachable.

Also, here is a very quick and dirty orange X-1.

It's very very easy to create this as long as you have access to Photoshop/Gimp. Just use the paint can tool on the layer "b".

![3be28a024f.jpg](http://puu.sh/jYFaL/3be28a024f.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-03T16:49:54Z" title="09/03/2015 04:49  PM" data-short="8 yr">September 3, 2015</time> by Beale**

> 
> Huh!
> I did not know that, probably a better size to use then.
> 
> The only sounding rocket mod I knew of [uses 0.35m](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102502-1-0-2-Sounding-Rockets!-Start-small-Dream-big!-0-2-1-2015-05-15)
> 
> Anyway, this very small size isn't a huge problem if the engine is surface attachable.

oh my bad I assumed roverdude used 0.3125m any way the other one is [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/133162-Backyard-Rocketry-For-all-your-homegrown-space-program-needs%21) though this split does bring what size to adopt more into question unfortunatly...
Very spiffy engine there! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I can't seem to find this mod on CKAN, even though kerbalstuff says it's there. I'm confused.

Anyway, it looks brilliant and I love your work, Beale.
Oooh. Very nice. I may need to muck about in this thing sometime. Maybe in KSP v1.1 whenever RSS/RO/RP-0 get converted. Try to give ole Chuck a run for his money.
